content.question: Compluribus navibus fractis, reliquae cum essent funibus, ancoris, reliquisque armamentis amissis ad navigandum inutiles, magna, id quod necesse erat accidere, totius exercitus perturbatio facta est. Neque enim naves erant aliae quibus reportari possent, et omnia deerant quae ad reficiendas naves erant usui et, quod omnibus 5constabat hiemari in Gallia oportere, frumentum his in locis in hiemem provisum non erat. Bellum Gallicum 4. 29 Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. In lines 1-3 (Compluribus . . . facta est), (A) identify one ablative absolute and (B) translate it in context. 2. What are the case and use of exercitus (line 3) ? 3. In lines 1-3 (Compluribus . . . facta est), (A) identify one gerund and (B) translate it in context. 4. In lines 1-3 (Compluribus . . . facta est), which three Latin words express Caesar’s opinion that the commotion was inevitable in this situation? 5. (A) Identify one present passive infinitive in this passage and (B) identify the verb it depends on. 6. In lines 3-6 (Neque . . . non erat), which four Latin words can be translated “were useful for repairing”? 7. (A) What are the case and use of omnibus (line 4) and (B) to whom or what does it refer? 8. In lines 3-6 (Neque . . . non erat), which four Latin words indicate the Romans’ original plan to not stay very long in Britain? 9. According to Book 1, what was unusual about the discussion held between Caesar and Ariovistus? Answer in 1-2 complete sentences.

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
